data.title: Add font configuration for the output console

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Suggestion:
Please add a possibility to change the font size of the output console. My general font size is too big for the output console. Something like this would be great:

- `output.console.fontSize`
- `output.console.fontFamily`

data.title: importing module with backticks breaks IntelliSense
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: latest (1.10.0-insider)
- OS Version: Windows 10 + Docker

Steps to Reproduce:

1. import a module in node.js with backtick qoutation. Example: const fs = require(`fs`);

2. check IntelliSense autocomplete. Example: fs dot


With double quote, IntelliSense works:
![doublequote](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22569741/23359586/f2dbb814-fcf7-11e6-86bc-b79663c2b62b.PNG)


However, with back-tick IntelliSense doesn't work.
![backtick](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22569741/23359595/ff624012-fcf7-11e6-9a4f-9050dba38224.PNG)

data.title: Toggle Word Wrap gets lost after touching settings.json
data.body:
* Run Toggle Word Wrap
* Execute View > Zoom In (this writes to user `settings.json` behind the scenes)

* observe: the word wrap state is reset again, Toggle Word Wrap needs to be run again.

data.title: Marketplace Request: Allows extensions to be published to a beta channel
data.body:
Much like VSCode has its own Insiders build, that auto-updates and allows for a tight feedback loop with actual users, it would be nice if something similar was available for extension authors.

Currently the process is to get people to uninstall the current extension, and manually install a .vsix extension. I propose that a beta-tab is added to an installed extension, where users can simply switch to the beta-channel if they want.

Then authors may be able to simply publish with a command like `vsce publish beta major/minor/patch`

data.title: Trigger character always force a new completion session
data.body:
from https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/issues/166#issuecomment-282667530

* have a completion item provider that is triggered on `*`
* have another completion item provider that return completions like `foo.bar`
* trigger completion from the latter, type to filter until the `.` ðŸ’¥

data.title: TypeScript returns stale code actions
data.body:
related to #21060

In the aforementioned issue TypeScript return a stale code action suggesting to add an import even though it has been added already. I assume this is because diagnostics computation has been scheduled but has not yet happened. The TS code action provider should synchronise with that actual source of code action.

data.title: TypeScript returns stale code actions
data.body:
related to #21060

In the aforementioned issue TypeScript return a stale code action suggesting to add an import even though it has been added already. I assume this is because diagnostics computation has been scheduled but has not yet happened. The TS code action provider should synchronise with that actual source of code action.

data.title: Translation input: can not find module iconv.node
data.body:
1. Mac, follow steps in [OneNote](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/DD_OTP/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fteams%2FDD_OTP%2FDocuments%2FTicino%2FNotebooks%2FVSCode&wd=target%28Development.one%7C8557A876-0489-401B-A073-CECF1B859862%2FLocalization%20VSCode%7C50625778-369E-4422-9157-5E143C02A7DF%2F%29)
2. Get an error when trying to run scripts in the `MonacoLocalization` folder

`gulp import --component vscode/src --locData ../VSCode-darwin/resources/app/out/nls.metadata.json --dest .`

```
(node:15833) fs: re-evaluating native module sources is not supported. If you are using the graceful-fs module, please update it to a more recent version.
module.js:457
    throw err;
    ^

Error: Cannot find module '../build/Debug/iconv.node'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:455:15)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:403:25)
    at Module.require (module.js:483:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:20:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/isidor/Development/MonacoLocalization/lib/node_modules/iconv/lib/iconv.js:29:14)
    at Module._compile (module.js:556:32)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:565:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:473:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:432:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:424:3)
```


On a related note: transforming backward to forward slashes is error prone. The one note should also contain exact instructions for mac.

data.title: Hard break at 100 column which break ligature for Fira Code
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change font to "Fira Code" with ligatures enabled
2. Type some code with 100+ symbols, i.e: 

``` javascript
const query = [`with tag_offers as (
      offer->>'price_list', offer->>'price_net', offer->>'price_used', offer->>'price_rent', offer->>'price_buyback',`];
```

![2017-02-24 19 15 31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/103639/23313284/c7690e18-fac5-11e6-903c-098d656cd512.png)

Notice the "hard break" at 100 column.
Ref: https://github.com/tonsky/FiraCode/issues/372

data.title: Provide a way for extensions to get a list of the opened editors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (b2a55bd66eb60af11c60ddd61b7581538b216051, 2017-02-24T20:30:00.778Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0

I'm building a new extension [Restore Editors](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=eamodio.restore-editors) to be able to save the current set of editors to be re-opened at a later time. Currently I am employing some [serious hackery](https://github.com/eamodio/vscode-restore-editors/blob/master/src/documentManager.ts#L57) to get a list of the opened editors.

It would be great if there was an api that an extension could use to get at that information. Ideally this would provide even more information than is accessible now -- in addition to the `uri` and `viewColumn`, it would be great if there was an `position` that would tell the order of the editors inside a column.

data.title: Support line ranges in links and to navigate to file to a particular line column
data.body:
The output window supports (hardcoded) local links to line ranges in its [LinkComputer](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/output/common/outputLinkComputer.ts#L83). The set of regular expressions matches the error messages from common build tools. It would be useful to also support this in the integrated terminal. 

Supporting links to line column would also cover #21401.

data.title: Support "Paste" & "Paste and Indent"
data.body:
In the Sublime Text we have ctrl + v/ctrl + shift + v for paste/paste and indent.
Could code support this?

It'll be even better to make paste and indent as default pasting behavior.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:
dotnet --info output:
.NET Command Line Tools (1.0.0-rc4-004771)

Product Information:
Version: 1.0.0-rc4-004771
Commit SHA-1 hash: 4228198f0e

Runtime Environment:
OS Name: ubuntu
OS Version: 16.04
OS Platform: Linux
RID: ubuntu.16.04-x64

VS Code version:
1.9.1
C# Extension version:
1.7.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Open a VS 2015 Community Edition Visual C#/Windows/universal Solution/Project
2. dotnet restore
3. dotnet build

Build FAILED.

/usr/share/dotnet/sdk/1.0.0-rc4-004771/Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targets(1111,5): error MSB3644: The refere
nce assemblies for framework ".NETFramework,Version=v4.5.2" were not found. To resolve this, install the SDK or T
argeting Pack for this framework version or retarget your application to a version of the framework for which you
have the SDK or Targeting Pack installed. Note that assemblies will be resolved from the Global Assembly Cache (
GAC) and will be used in place of reference assemblies. Therefore your assembly may not be correctly targeted for
the framework you intend. [/home/wallyz/DBTransferImportAgent/DropBoxTransferAgent.csproj]
0 Warning(s)
1 Error(s)

Additional Comments

I have tried changing the framework to a variety of different versions but none are found.

Pointers to some documentation for supported .Net target frameworks would be appreciated. I recall reading something on the web but now can't find anything.

Also tried the dotnet msbuild with same results.

data.title: No longer possible to paste into explorer without selection to duplicate a file
data.body:
Steps:
* copy an item in the explorer
* unselect all items from the explorer (you should see the blue outline around the entire tree)
* paste

=> there is still a regression that pasting does not work in this case (it used to work)

data.title: Output Window: Setting to Stop Wrapping

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Win 7/64 Home Premium SP 1

Please introduce a setting (ideally changeable via API) to allow an output window (panel) to NOT word-wrap.

Reason: I've modified the TODO Parser extension (https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=minhthai.vscode-todo-parser) to write its output in tabular form, which is more concise length-wise. However, the unavoidable word wrapping in the output window usually messes up the formatting. In such cases, it would be preferable for an extension to be able to open an output window that DIDN'T word wrap, and allowed the user to scroll horizontally if required.

This suggestion was mentioned as an aside at https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2806#issuecomment-191361158.

data.title: Double-click anywhere on an un-pinned editor should pin it
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (b2a55bd66eb60af11c60ddd61b7581538b216051, 2017-02-24T20:30:00.778Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0

Currently the only way to "pin" an editor is either to double-click on the tab itself or start editing. It would be nice if just double-clicking on the editor itself would cause it to be pinned -- that way you don't have to travel so far when attempting to open multiple files.

data.title: A better way to provide multi-line Snippets support
data.body:
ps: I'm not  excellent in English, but I'll try to make it clear.

now, we add custom snippets use json file, for example, add a for loop snippets:
```json
"For Loop": {
        "prefix": "for",
        "body": [
            "for (var ${1:index} = 0; ${1:index} < ${2:array}.length; ${1:index}++) {",
            "\tvar ${3:element} = ${2:array}[${1:index}];",
            "\t$0",
            "}"
        ],
        "description": "For Loop"
    }
```
In `body`, we need add useless quotes and `\t` for good format, I think this is not good enough.

But if we use some Notations like  [CSON]("https://github.com/bevry/cson"), we write snippets will like this:
```
'For Loop':
    'prefix': 'for'
    'body': """
        for (var ${1:index} = 0; ${1:index} < ${2:array}.length; ${1:index}++) {
            var ${3:element} = ${2:array}[${1:index}];
            $0
            }
"""
```
I think this is a better way to write snippets.
or we just use it like
#15140
